get.description: Get the status of the server.

post.description: Initialize the robot to its initial position before starting the teleoperation.
Start a UDP server to send and receive teleoperation data to the robot.
Stop the UDP server main loop.
Move the robot to an absolute position specified by the end-effector (in centimeters and degrees). Make sure to call `/move/init` before using this endpoint.
Move the robot to a relative position based on received delta values (in centimeters and degrees).

post.summary: Make the robot say hello (test endpoint)
post.description: Make the robot say hello by opening and closing its gripper. (Test endpoint)

post.summary: Put the robot to its sleep position
post.description: Put the robot to its sleep position by giving direct instructions to joints. This function disables the torque.
Retrieve the position, orientation, and open status of the robot's end effector. Only available for manipulators.
Read the current voltage of the robot's motors.
Read the current Temperature and maximum Temperature of the robot's motors.

post.summary: Write the Maximum Temperature for Joints
post.description: Set the robot's maximum temperature for motors..
Read the current torque of the robot's joints.
Enable or disable the torque of the robot.
Read the current positions of the robot's joints in radians and motor units.
Move the robot's joints to the specified angles.
Start the calibration sequence for the robot.

post.summary: Use the leader arm to control the follower arm
post.description: Use the leader arm to control the follower arm.
Stop the leader-follower control.
Enable gravity compensation for the robot.
Stop the gravity compensation.

post.summary: Get the status of the auto control by AI
post.description: Get the status of the auto control by AI.
Start an inference server and return the server info.

post.summary: Start the auto control by AI
post.description: Start the auto control by AI.

post.summary: Stop the auto control by AI
post.description: Stop the auto control by AI.

post.summary: Pause the auto control by AI
post.description: Pause the auto control by AI.

post.summary: Resume the auto control by AI
post.description: Resume the auto control by AI.

post.summary: Feedback about the AI control session

post.description:
Manually add a robot connection to the robot manager.
Useful for adding robot that are accessible only via WiFi, for example.

Manually add a robot connection to the robot manager.
Useful for adding robot that are accessible only via WiFi, for example.
Get the configuration of the robot.
Get current teleoperation settings.
Update teleoperation settings such as VR scaling factor.

get.description: Stream video feed of the specified camera. If no camera id is provided, the default camera is used. Specify a target size and quality using query parameters.

200.description: Streaming video feed of the specified camera.

get.description: Capture frames from all available cameras. Returns a dictionary with camera IDs as keys and base64 encoded JPG images as values. If a camera is not available or fails to capture, its value will be None.

200.description: Successfully captured frames from available cameras

schema.title: Response Get All Camera Frames Frames Get

post.description: Refresh the list of available cameras. This operation can take a few seconds as it disconnects and reconnects to all cameras. It is useful when cameras are added or removed while the application is running.

schema.title: Response Refresh Camera List Cameras Refresh Post

post.description: Add a camera feed from a ZMQ publisher.

schema.title: Response Add Zmq Camera Feed Cameras Add Zmq Post

post.description:
Asynchronously start recording an episode in the background.
Output format is chosen when stopping the recording.
Stop the recording of the episode. The data is saved to disk to the user home directory, in the `phosphobot` folder.
Play a recorded episode.
Get the list of models with aggregated AI control session metrics
Start training an ACT or gr00t model on the specified dataset. This will upload a trained model to the Hugging Face Hub using the main branch of the specified dataset.

get.description: Stream the logs from a log file

post.description: Cancel a training job
Reset a user's password using the recovery tokens from the Supabase reset email.
Send a password reset email to the provided email address.

get.description: Page with an overview of the connected cameras. Open this page in the chrome browser.

post.description: Get the dataset keys and frames.
Merge two datasets into one.
List all datasets that are both in Hugging Face and locally.

Delete an episode from the dataset.
Parameters:
- episode_id: int: The episode ID to delete.
- path: str: The path to the dataset folder.

get.description: Download a folder as a ZIP file.

post.description: Fetch the model info from Hugging Face and return its configuration.

- Fetch the info.json from the model repo and return the training info.
- If the model type is "custom", return a custom command to run the training.

Repair a dataset by removing any corrupted files.
For now, this only works for parquets files.
If the parquets are wrongly indexed, it will not do anything.

Split a dataset into two datasets.
Used for creating training and validation datasets.
Shuffle a dataset in place.

Endpoint to activate the hotspot on the Raspberry Pi.
Returns immediately and performs setup in the background.

Endpoint to connect phosphobot to a new network.
Returns immediately and performs connection in the background.
Will fallback to the hotspot if it fails to connect.

Endpoint to list all IP addresses on the local network.
Returns a list of IP addresses.
Endpoint to list all devices connected to the system.

Get the latest available version of the teleop software.
Works only on raspberry pi devices.

schema.title: Response Get Latest Available Version Update Version Post

get.description:
Upgrade the teleop software to the latest available version.
Checks the latest available version and upgrades the software if necessary.
Works only on raspberry pi devices.

schema.title: Response Upgrade To Latest Version Update Upgrade To Latest Version Get

post.description: Sign up a new user.
Sign in an existing user.
Verify the email confirmation code sent to the user.

get.description:
Check if the user is authenticated by validating the session with Supabase.
Returns a JSON response indicating authentication status.

post.description: Endpoint to handle AI control chat requests.
Log the first chat request to the database.

AIControlStatusResponse.title: AIControlStatusResponse
AIControlStatusResponse.description: Response when starting the AI control.

id.title: Id
id.description: ID of the AI control session.

AIStatusResponse.title: AIStatusResponse
AIStatusResponse.description: Response to the AI status request.

tcp_address.title: Tcp Address
tcp_address.description: TCP address of the ZMQ publisher. Format: 'tcp://<host>:<port>'.

topic.title: Topic
topic.description: Topic to subscribe to. If None, will subscribes to all messages on the given TCP address.

AddZMQCameraRequest.title: AddZMQCameraRequest
AddZMQCameraRequest.description: Request model for adding a ZMQ camera feed.

AdminSettingsResponse.title: AdminSettingsResponse
AdminSettingsResponse.description: Contains the settings returned in the admin page

AdminSettingsTokenResponse.title: AdminSettingsTokenResponse
AdminSettingsTokenResponse.description:
To each provider is assigned a bool, which is True
if the token is set and valid.

is_stereo_camera_available.title: Is Stereo Camera Available
is_stereo_camera_available.description: Whether a stereoscopic camera is available.

realsense_available.title: Realsense Available
realsense_available.description: Whether a RealSense camera is available.

video_cameras_ids.title: Video Cameras Ids
video_cameras_ids.description: List of camera ids that are video cameras.

AllCamerasStatus.title: AllCamerasStatus
AllCamerasStatus.description: Description of the status of all cameras. Use this to know which camera to stream.

source.title: Source
source.description: Which hand the data comes from. Can be left or right.

direction_x.title: Direction X
direction_x.description: Direction vector X, normalized between -1 (left) and 1 (right)

direction_y.title: Direction Y
direction_y.description: Direction vector Y, normalized between -1 (backward) and 1 (forward)

AppControlData.title: AppControlData
AppControlData.description: Type of data sent by the Metaquest app.

gripping_threshold.title: Gripping Threshold
gripping_threshold.description: Torque threshold to consider an object gripped. This will block the gripper position and prevent it from moving further.

non_gripping_threshold.title: Non Gripping Threshold
non_gripping_threshold.description: Torque threshold to consider an object not gripped. This will allow the gripper to move freely.

BrowserFilesRequest.title: BrowserFilesRequest
BrowserFilesRequest.description: Request to browse files in a directory.

calibration_status.title: Calibration Status
calibration_status.description: Status of the calibration. Ends when status is success or error.

training_id.title: Training Id
training_id.description: ID of the training to cancel.

chat_id.title: Chat Id
chat_id.description: Unique identifier for the chat session. If not provided, a new UUID will be generated.

prompt.title: Prompt
prompt.description: The task to be performed by the robot, described in natural language.

images.title: Images
images.description: base64 encoded images to be sent with the request.

command_history.title: Command History
command_history.description: List of previous commands to provide context for the chat.

ChatRequest.title: ChatRequest
ChatRequest.description: Control the robot with a natural language prompt.

command.title: Command
command.description: The command to be executed by the robot, generated from the prompt.

endpoint_params.title: Endpoint Params
endpoint_params.description: Parameters to pass to the endpoint.

custom_command.title: Custom Command
custom_command.description: Will run this custom command as a subprocess when pressing the train button.

dataset_path.title: Dataset Path
dataset_path.description: Path to the dataset to repair

dataset_path.title: Dataset Path
dataset_path.description: Path to the dataset to shuffle

dataset_path.title: Dataset Path
dataset_path.description: Path to the dataset to split

split_ratio.title: Split Ratio
split_ratio.description: Ratio of the dataset to use for the first split. The second split will use the rest of the dataset.

EndEffectorPosition.title: EndEffectorPosition
EndEffectorPosition.description:
End effector position for a movement in absolute frame.
All zeros means the initial position, that you get by calling /move/init

sync.title: Sync
sync.description: If True, the simulation will first read the motor positions, synchronize them with the simulated robot, and then return the end effector position.Useful for measurements, however it will take more time to respond.

only_gripper.title: Only Gripper
only_gripper.description: If True, only return the gripper state. If False, return the full end effector position and orientation.

feedback.title: Feedback
feedback.description: Feedback on the AI control. Can be positive or negative.

ai_control_id.title: Ai Control Id
ai_control_id.description: ID of the AI control session.

HuggingFaceTokenRequest.title: HuggingFaceTokenRequest
HuggingFaceTokenRequest.description: Hugging Face token saved by the user.

unit.title: Unit
unit.description: The unit of the angles. Defaults to radian.

joints_ids.title: Joints Ids
joints_ids.description: If set, only read the joints with these ids. If None, read all joints.

source.title: Source
source.description: Source of the joint angles. 'sim' means the angles are read from the simulation, 'robot' means the angles are read from the hardware.

JointsReadRequest.title: JointsReadRequest
JointsReadRequest.description: Request to read the joints of the robot.

angles.title: Angles
angles.description: A list of length 6, with the position of each joint in the unit specified in the request. If a joint is not available, its value will be None.

unit.title: Unit
unit.description: The unit of the angles. Defaults to radian.

JointsReadResponse.title: JointsReadResponse
JointsReadResponse.description: Response to read the joints of the robot.

angles.title: Angles
angles.description: A list with the position of each joint. The length of the list must be equal to the number of joints. The unit is given by the 'unit' field.

unit.title: Unit
unit.description: The unit of the angles. Defaults to radian.

joints_ids.title: Joints Ids
joints_ids.description: If set, only set the joints with these ids. If None, set all joints.Example: 'angles'=[1,1,1], 'joints_ids'=[0,1,2] will set the first 3 joints to 1 radian.

JointsWriteRequest.title: JointsWriteRequest
JointsWriteRequest.description: Request to set the joints of the robot.

first_dataset.title: First Dataset
first_dataset.description: Path to the first dataset to merge

second_dataset.title: Second Dataset
second_dataset.description: Path to the second dataset to merge

new_dataset_name.title: New Dataset Name
new_dataset_name.description: Name of the new dataset to create

image_key_mappings.title: Image Key Mappings
image_key_mappings.description: Mapping of the image keys from the first dataset to the second dataset.

model_id.title: Model Id
model_id.description: Hugging Face model id to use

video_keys.title: Video Keys
video_keys.description: List of video keys for the model. These are the keys used to access the videos in the dataset.

checkpoints.title: Checkpoints
checkpoints.description: List of available checkpoints for the model.

rx.title: Rx
rx.description: Absolute Pitch in degrees. If None, inverse kinematics will be used to calculate the best position.

ry.title: Ry
ry.description: Absolute Yaw in degrees. If None, inverse kinematics will be used to calculate the best position.

rz.title: Rz
rz.description: Absolute Roll in degrees. If None, inverse kinematics will be used to calculate the best position.

max_trials.title: Max Trials
max_trials.description: The maximum number of trials to reach the target position.

position_tolerance.title: Position Tolerance
position_tolerance.description: Increase max_trials and decrease tolerance to get more precision.Position tolerance is the euclidean distance between the target and the current position.

orientation_tolerance.title: Orientation Tolerance
orientation_tolerance.description: Increase max_trials and decrease tolerance to get more precision.Orientation tolerance is the euclidean distance between the target and the current orientation.

MoveAbsoluteRequest.title: MoveAbsoluteRequest
MoveAbsoluteRequest.description:
Move the robot to an absolute position. All zeros means the initial position,
that you get by calling /move/init.

dataset_format.title: Dataset Format
dataset_format.description: Format of the dataset to play. This is used to determine how to read the episode data.

dataset_name.title: Dataset Name
dataset_name.description: Name of the dataset to play the episode from. If None, defaults to the last dataset recorded.

episode_id.title: Episode Id
episode_id.description: ID of the episode to play. If a dataset_name is specified but episode_id is None, plays the last episode recorded of this dataset. If dataset_name is None, this is ignored and plays the last episode recorded.

episode_path.title: Episode Path
episode_path.description: (Optional) If you recorded your data with LeRobot v2 compatible format, you can directly specifiy the path to the .parquet file of the episode to play. If specified, you don't have to pass a dataset_name or episode_id.

robot_id.title: Robot Id
robot_id.description: ID of the robot to play the episode on. If None, plays on all robots. If a list, plays on the robots with the given IDs.

robot_serials_to_ignore.title: Robot Serials To Ignore
robot_serials_to_ignore.description: List of robot serial ids to ignore. If set to None, plays on all available robots.

replicate.title: Replicate
replicate.description: If False and there are more robots than number of robots in the episode, extra robots will not move. If True, all the extras robots will replicate movements of the robots in the episode.Examples: If there are 4 robots and the episode has 2 robots, if replicate is True, robot 3 and 4 will replicate the movements of robot 1 and 2. If replicate is False, robot 3 and 4 will not move.

playback_speed.title: Playback Speed
playback_speed.description: Speed of the playback. 1.0 is normal speed, 0.5 is half speed, 2.0 is double speed. High speed may cause the robot to break.

interpolation_factor.title: Interpolation Factor
interpolation_factor.description: Smoothen the playback by interpolating between frames. 1 means no interpolation, 2 means 1 frame every 2 frames, etc. 4 is the recommended value.

RecordingPlayRequest.title: RecordingPlayRequest
RecordingPlayRequest.description: Request to play a recorded episode.

dataset_name.title: Dataset Name
dataset_name.description: Name of the dataset to save the episode in.If None, defaults to the value set in Admin Configuration.

episode_format.title: Episode Format
episode_format.description:
Format to save the episode.
`json` is compatible with OpenVLA and stores videos as a series of npy.
`lerobot_v2` is compatible with [lerobot training.](https://docs.phospho.ai/learn/ai-models).If None, defaults to the value set in Admin Configuration.

video_codec.title: Video Codec
video_codec.description: Codec to use for the video saving.If None, defaults to the value set in Admin Configuration.

freq.title: Freq
freq.description: Records steps of the robot at this frequency.If None, defaults to the value set in Admin Configuration.

branch_path.title: Branch Path
branch_path.description: Path to the branch to push the dataset to, in addition to the main branch. If set to None, only push to the main branch. Defaults to None.

target_video_size.title: Target Video Size
target_video_size.description: Target video size for the recording, all videos in the dataset should have the same size. If set to None, defaults to the value set in Admin Configuration.

cameras_ids_to_record.title: Cameras Ids To Record
cameras_ids_to_record.description: List of camera ids to record. If set to None, records all available cameras.

instruction.title: Instruction
instruction.description: A text describing the recorded task. If set to None, defaults to the value set in Admin Configuration.
examples: Pick up the orange brick and put it in the black box.

robot_serials_to_ignore.title: Robot Serials To Ignore
robot_serials_to_ignore.description: List of robot serial ids to ignore. If set to None, records all available robots.

leader_arm_ids.title: Leader Arm Ids
leader_arm_ids.description: Serial numbers of the leader arms used during the recording

save_cartesian.title: Save Cartesian
save_cartesian.description: Record cartesian positions of the robots as well, this will make your dataset incompatible with lerobot and it only works for robots with simulators. Defaults to False.

add_metadata.title: Add Metadata
add_metadata.description: Passing a dictionnary will store the value in each row of the recorded dataset. The key is the name of the column, and the value is a list. If set to None, no additional metadata is saved.

RecordingStartRequest.title: RecordingStartRequest
RecordingStartRequest.description: Request to start the recording of an episode.

save.title: Save
save.description: Whether to save the episode to disk. Defaults to True.

RecordingStopRequest.title: RecordingStopRequest
RecordingStopRequest.description: Request to stop the recording of the episode.

episode_folder_path.title: Episode Folder Path
episode_folder_path.description: Path to the folder where the episode is saved.

episode_index.title: Episode Index
episode_index.description: Index of the recorded episode in the dataset.

RecordingStopResponse.title: RecordingStopResponse
RecordingStopResponse.description: Response when the recording is stopped. The episode is saved in the given path.

open.title: Open
open.description: 0 for closed, 1 for open. If None, use the last value.

RelativeEndEffectorPosition.title: RelativeEndEffectorPosition
RelativeEndEffectorPosition.description:
Relative end effector position for a movement in relative frame.
Useful for OpenVLA-like control.

access_token.title: Access Token
access_token.description: Access token from the reset email

refresh_token.title: Refresh Token
refresh_token.description: Refresh token from the reset email

new_password.title: New Password
new_password.description: New password to set for the user

RobotConfigStatus.title: RobotConfigStatus
RobotConfigStatus.description: Contains the configuration of a robot.

robot_name.title: Robot Name
robot_name.description: Type of the robot to connect to.

connection_details.title: Connection Details
connection_details.description: Connection details for the robot. These are passed to the class constructor. This can include IP address, port, and other connection parameters.

RobotConnectionRequest.title: RobotConnectionRequest
RobotConnectionRequest.description: Request to manually connect to a robot.

leader_id.title: Leader Id
leader_id.description: Serial number of the leader robot

follower_id.title: Follower Id
follower_id.description: Serial number of the follower robot

RobotPairRequest.title: RobotPairRequest
RobotPairRequest.description: Represents a pair of robots for leader-follower control.

ScanDevicesResponse.title: ScanDevicesResponse
ScanDevicesResponse.description: Response to the USB devices scan request.

robot_name.title: Robot Name
robot_name.description: Name of the robot to scan for. If None, scans for all devices on the network.

ScanNetworkRequest.title: ScanNetworkRequest
ScanNetworkRequest.description: Request to scan the network for devices.

devices.title: Devices
devices.description: List of devices found on the network.

ScanNetworkResponse.title: ScanNetworkResponse
ScanNetworkResponse.description: Response to the network scan request.

version_id.title: Version Id
version_id.description: Current version of the teleoperation server

is_recording.title: Is Recording
is_recording.description: Whether the server is currently recording an episode.

ai_running_status.title: Ai Running Status
ai_running_status.description: Whether the robot is currently controlled by an AI model.

leader_follower_status.title: Leader Follower Status
leader_follower_status.description: Whether the leader-follower control is currently active.

server_ip.title: Server Ip
server_ip.description: IP address of the phosphobot server

ServerStatus.title: ServerStatus
ServerStatus.description: Contains the status of the app

Session.title: Session
Session.description: Session model for storing supabase session details.

camera_type.title: Camera Type
camera_type.description:
Type of camera.
`classic`: Standard camera detected by OpenCV.
`stereo`: Stereoscopic camera. It has two lenses: left eye and right eye to give a 3D effect. The left half of the image is the left eye, and the right half is the right eye.
`realsense`: Intel RealSense camera. It use infrared sensors to provide depth information. It requires a special driver.
`dummy`: Dummy camera. Used for testing.
`dummy_stereo`: Dummy stereoscopic camera. Used for testing.
`unknown`: Unknown camera type.

prompt.title: Prompt
prompt.description: Prompt to be followed by the robot

model_id.title: Model Id
model_id.description: Hugging Face model id to use

speed.title: Speed
speed.description: Speed of the AI control. 1.0 is normal speed, 0.5 is half speed, 2.0 is double speed. The highest speed is still bottlenecked by the GPU inference time.

robot_serials_to_ignore.title: Robot Serials To Ignore
robot_serials_to_ignore.description: List of robot serial ids to ignore. If set to None, controls all available robots.

cameras_keys_mapping.title: Cameras Keys Mapping
cameras_keys_mapping.description: Mapping of the camera keys to the camera ids. If set to None, use the default mapping based on cameras order.

model_type.title: Model Type
model_type.description: Type of model to use. Can be gr00t, act, pi0.5, or smolvla.

selected_camera_id.title: Selected Camera Id
selected_camera_id.description: Name of the camera to use when ACT_BBOX model is used. This is only required for ACT_BBOX models, and is ignored for other models.

verify_cameras.title: Verify Cameras
verify_cameras.description: Whether to verify the setup before starting the AI control. If False, skips the verification step.

checkpoint.title: Checkpoint
checkpoint.description: Checkpoint to use for the model. If None, uses the latest checkpoint.

angle_format.title: Angle Format
angle_format.description: Format of the angles used in the model. Can be 'degrees', 'radians', or 'other'. If other is selected, you will need to specify a min and max angle value.

min_angle.title: Min Angle
min_angle.description: If angle_format is 'other', this is the minimum angle value used in the model. If None and angle_format is 'other', will raise an error.

max_angle.title: Max Angle
max_angle.description: If angle_format is 'other', this is the maximum angle value used in the model. If None and angle_format is 'other', will raise an error.

StartAIControlRequest.title: StartAIControlRequest
StartAIControlRequest.description: Request to start the AI control of the robot.

robot_pairs.title: Robot Pairs
robot_pairs.description: List of robot pairs to control. Each pair contains the robot id of the leader and the corresponding follower.

invert_controls.title: Invert Controls
invert_controls.description: Mirror controls for the follower robots

enable_gravity_compensation.title: Enable Gravity Compensation
enable_gravity_compensation.description: Enable gravity compensation for the leader robots

gravity_compensation_values.title: Gravity Compensation Values
gravity_compensation_values.description: Gravity compensation pourcentage values for shoulder, elbow, and wrist joints (0-100%)

StartLeaderArmControlRequest.title: StartLeaderArmControlRequest
StartLeaderArmControlRequest.description:
Request to set up leader-follower control. The leader robot will be controlled by the user,
and the follower robot will mirror the leader's movements.

You need two robots connected to the same computer to use this feature.

model_id.title: Model Id
model_id.description: Hugging Face model id to use

robot_serials_to_ignore.title: Robot Serials To Ignore
robot_serials_to_ignore.description: List of robot serial ids to ignore. If set to None, controls all available robots.

model_type.title: Model Type
model_type.description: Type of model to use. Can be gr00t, act, pi0.5, or smolvla.

StartServerRequest.title: StartServerRequest
StartServerRequest.description: Request to start an inference server and get the server info.

training_id.title: Training Id
training_id.description: ID of the training to start. This is the ID returned by the training request.

model_url.title: Model Url
model_url.description: URL to the Hugging Face model card.

StatusResponse.title: StatusResponse
StatusResponse.description: Default response. May contain other fields.

vr_scaling.title: Vr Scaling
vr_scaling.description: VR scaling factor for teleoperation control.

vr_scaling.title: Vr Scaling
vr_scaling.description: VR scaling factor for teleoperation control.

TeleopSettingsRequest.title: TeleopSettingsRequest
TeleopSettingsRequest.description: Request model for updating teleop settings.

current_max_Temperature.title: Current Max Temperature
current_max_Temperature.description: A list of Temperature objects, one for each joint. If the robot is not connected, this will be None.

TemperatureReadResponse.title: TemperatureReadResponse
TemperatureReadResponse.description: Response to read the Temperature of the robot.

maximum_temperature.title: Maximum Temperature
maximum_temperature.description: A list with the maximum temperature of each joint. The length of the list must be equal to the number of joints.

TemperatureWriteRequest.title: TemperatureWriteRequest
TemperatureWriteRequest.description: Request to set the maximum Temperature for joints of the robot.

torque_status.title: Torque Status
torque_status.description: Whether to enable or disable torque control.

TorqueControlRequest.title: TorqueControlRequest
TorqueControlRequest.description: Request to control the robot's torque.

current_torque.title: Current Torque
current_torque.description: A list of length 6, with the current torque of each joint.

TorqueReadResponse.title: TorqueReadResponse
TorqueReadResponse.description: Response to read the torque of the robot.

model_id.title: Model Id
model_id.description: Hugging Face model id to get training info

batch_size.title: Batch Size
batch_size.description: Batch size for training, we run this on an A10G. Leave it to None to auto-detect based on your dataset

steps.title: Steps
steps.description: Number of training steps. Leave it to None to auto-detect based on your dataset

save_freq.title: Save Freq
save_freq.description: Number of steps between saving the model.

TrainingParamsAct.title: TrainingParamsAct
TrainingParamsAct.description: Training parameters are left to None by default and are set depending on the dataset in the training pipeline.

batch_size.title: Batch Size
batch_size.description: Batch size for training, we run this on an A10G. Leave it to None to auto-detect based on your dataset

steps.title: Steps
steps.description: Number of training steps. Leave it to None to auto-detect based on your dataset

save_freq.title: Save Freq
save_freq.description: Number of steps between saving the model.

target_detection_instruction.title: Target Detection Instruction
target_detection_instruction.description: Instruction for the target object to detect, e.g. 'red/orange lego brick'
target_detection_instruction.default: e.g.: green lego brick, red ball, blue plushy...

image_key.title: Image Key
image_key.description: Key for the image to run detection on, e.g. 'main' or 'images.main'

image_keys_to_keep.title: Image Keys To Keep
image_keys_to_keep.description: Optional list of image keys to keep. If none, all image keys will be dropped.

TrainingParamsActWithBbox.title: TrainingParamsActWithBbox
TrainingParamsActWithBbox.description: Training parameters for ACT with bounding box

validation_dataset_name.title: Validation Dataset Name
validation_dataset_name.description: Optional dataset repository ID on Hugging Face to use for validation

batch_size.title: Batch Size
batch_size.description: Batch size for training. Decrease it if you get an Out Of Memory (OOM) error

num_epochs.title: Num Epochs
num_epochs.description: Number of epochs to train for.

save_steps.title: Save Steps
save_steps.description: Number of steps between saving the model.

data_dir.title: Data Dir
data_dir.description: The directory to save the dataset to

validation_data_dir.title: Validation Data Dir
validation_data_dir.description: Optional directory to save the validation dataset to. If None, validation is not run.

output_dir.title: Output Dir
output_dir.description: The directory to save the model to

data_image_keys.title: Data Image Keys
data_image_keys.description: Comma-separated list of image keys to use for training

save_interval.title: Save Interval
save_interval.description: Number of steps to save the model.

batch_size.title: Batch Size
batch_size.description: Batch size for training. Decrease it if you get an Out Of Memory (OOM) error

batch_size.title: Batch Size
batch_size.description: Batch size for training, we run this on an A10G. Leave it to None to auto-detect based on your dataset

steps.title: Steps
steps.description: Number of training steps. Leave it to None to auto-detect based on your dataset

save_freq.title: Save Freq
save_freq.description: Number of steps between saving the model.

TrainingParamsSmolVLA.title: TrainingParamsSmolVLA
TrainingParamsSmolVLA.description: Training parameters are left to None by default and are set depending on the dataset in the training pipeline.

model_type.title: Model Type
model_type.description: Type of model to train, supports 'ACT', 'gr00t', 'pi0.5', and 'smolvla'

dataset_name.title: Dataset Name
dataset_name.description: Dataset repository ID on Hugging Face, should be a public dataset

model_name.title: Model Name
model_name.description: Name of the trained model to upload to Hugging Face, should be in the format phospho-app/<model_name> or <model_name>

wandb_api_key.title: Wandb Api Key
wandb_api_key.description: WandB API key for tracking training, you can find it at https://wandb.ai/authorize

private_mode.title: Private Mode
private_mode.description: Whether to use private training (PRO users only)

user_hf_token.title: User Hf Token
user_hf_token.description: User's personal HF token for private training

TrainingRequest.title: TrainingRequest
TrainingRequest.description:
Pydantic model for training request validation.
This version consolidates all model name and parameter logic into a single
validator to prevent redundant operations and fix the duplicate suffix bug.

current_voltage.title: Current Voltage
current_voltage.description: A list of length 6, with the current voltage of each joint. If the robot is not connected, this will be None.

VoltageReadResponse.title: VoltageReadResponse
VoltageReadResponse.description: Response to read the torque of the robot.

WandBTokenRequest.title: WandBTokenRequest
WandBTokenRequest.description: WandB token saved by the user.
